topPRs.title: test(contracts): convert DisputeMonitorHelper tests to fuzz tests
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Converts focused tests in `DisputeMonitorHelper.t.sol` to fuzz tests for broader coverage:

1. **toRpcHexString tests**: Combined two focused tests into a single fuzz test that validates hex string format properties (starts with "0x", no leading zeros). Added explicit test for zero value edge case.

2. **search tests**: Converted `test_search_olderThanEverything_succeeds` and `test_search_newerThanEverything_succeeds` from using `vm.randomUint` to proper fuzz tests with bounded parameters. Timestamps are bounded to uint64 range since the contract truncates to uint64 in the search function (line 131 of source).

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] Verify the fuzz test assertions for `toRpcHexString` are sufficient - the original tests verified exact hex outputs for specific inputs, while the new test validates format properties. Consider if this tradeoff is acceptable.
- [ ] Confirm the uint64 bounds in search tests match the contract's actual timestamp handling (`uint64(timestamp.raw())` on line 131 of `DisputeMonitorHelper.sol`)

**Test plan**: Run `just test-dev --match-path test/periphery/monitoring/DisputeMonitorHelper.t.sol -v` to verify all 14 tests pass.

### Notes

Link to Devin run: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/64721700e8b645e697fa9d07babcccb4
Requested by: Ariel Diaz (@aliersh)

Last update: 2025-12-25 02:25 ET
